com.isoterik.mgdx.input

Class InputManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.InputAdapter
      • com.isoterik.mgdx.input.InputManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.input.GestureDetector.GestureListener, com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor

    public class InputManager
extends com.badlogic.gdx.InputAdapter
implements com.badlogic.gdx.input.GestureDetector.GestureListener
    An instance of this class is used to manage all input-related tasks of a Scene. It uses ITriggers to determine when InputListeners should be invoked. InputListeners can be mapped.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int[] MOUSE_BUTTONS
      An array of supported mouse buttons.

      • addMapping

        public boolean addMapping(java.lang.String mappingName,
                          ITrigger trigger,
                          ITrigger... triggers)
        Creates a new mapping and map the given triggers. Note: this will not modify existing mappings. If you want to update an existing mapping, use updateMapping(String, ITrigger, ITrigger...)
        Parameters:
        mappingName - a unique name for the mapping
        trigger - a trigger to map
        triggers - more triggers to map
        Returns:
        true if the mapping was created, false if the mapping already exists

      • updateMapping

                             ITrigger trigger,
                             ITrigger... triggers)
        Updates an existing mapping
        Parameters:
        mappingName - the name of the mapping to modify
        trigger - a trigger to add
        triggers - more triggers to add
        Returns:
        true if the mapping was modified, false if the mapping doesn't exist

      • removeAllMappedListeners

        public void removeAllMappedListeners()
        Removes all mapped listeners of every mapping. Note:
        • This wont remove mapped triggers. Use removeAllMappedTriggers() to remove all mapped triggers.
        • This wont remove the mappings. Use removeAllMappings() to remove all mappings

      • __update

        public void __update()
        Called every frame internally by the system. This is where polled triggers gets evaluated and fired if need be. Do not call this method explicitly

        the difference between the given pointer location and the last pointer location on the y-axis (in world units).

      • getPanDeltaY

        public float getPanDeltaY()
        Returns:
        the difference between the current pointer location and the last pointer location on the y-axis (in world units).

      • getAccelerationX

        public float getAccelerationX()
        Returns:
        acceleration around the x-axis scaled to the range [0, 1]

      • getAccelerationY

        public float getAccelerationY()
        Returns:
        acceleration around the y-axis scaled to the range [0, 1]

      • getAccelerationZ

        public float getAccelerationZ()
        Returns:
        acceleration around the z-axis scaled to the range [0, 1]

      • setCatchBackKey

        public void setCatchBackKey(boolean catchBackKey)
        Determines whether to prevent the BACK (on android devices) from exiting the application when pressed. This is handy for creating custom behaviors in such scenarios. For example; show confirmation dialog.

        Note: This setting affects every instance of InputManager. Use addOnBackpressListener(IKeyListener) to define custom behaviors.

        Parameters:
        catchBackKey - if true the BACK key will stop exiting the application when pressed

      • setCursorCatched

        public void setCursorCatched(boolean cursorCatched)
        Determines whether the mouse cursor is displayed.

        Note: This setting affects every instance of InputManager.

        Parameters:
        cursorCatched - if true the cursor won't be displayed, else it displays.

      • setCursorPosition

        public void setCursorPosition(int x,
                              int y)
        Sets the current position of the mouse cursor.

        Note: This setting affects every instance of InputManager.

        Parameters:
        x - the position on the x-coordinate.
        y - the position on the y-coordinate.

      • __initPools

        public static void __initPools()
        Initializes the internal pools. This method is called internally by the system. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD
